qas.question: How many US House reps did Oklahoma have before the 2000 census?
How many US House reps did Oklahoma have after the 2000 census?
How many of Oklahoma's House reps were Republican in 2012?
What political party are Oklahoma's US Senators?

context: Following the 2000 census, the Oklahoma delegation to the U.S. House of Representatives was reduced from <a0_0>six<a0_0/> to <a1_0>five<a1_0/> representatives, each serving one congressional district. For the 112th Congress (2011–2013), there were no changes in party strength, and the delegation included <a2_0>four<a2_0/> Republicans and one Democrat. In the 112th Congress, Oklahoma's U.S. senators were <a4_0>Republicans<a4_0/> <a3_0>Jim Inhofe and Tom Coburn<a3_0/>, and its U.S. Representatives were John Sullivan (R-OK-1), Dan Boren (D-OK-2), Frank D. Lucas (R-OK-3), Tom Cole (R-OK-4), and James Lankford (R-OK-5).
